protocol.description:
notification_shell allows clients to create desktop notification on host.
Warning! The protocol described in this file is experimental and backward incompatible changes may be made. Backward compatible changes may be added together with the corresponding interface version bump. Backward incompatible changes are done by bumping the version number in the protocol and interface names and resetting the interface version. Once the protocol is to be declared stable, the 'z' prefix and the version number in the protocol and interface names are removed and the interface version number is reset.

interface.name: zcr_notification_shell_v1
interface.description: An interface that is used for creating desktop notification on host.

request.name: create_notification

description.summary: create a desktop notification from plain text

request.description: Creates a desktop notification from plain text information.

arg.name: display_source
arg.summary: textual representation of who's shown the notification

request.name: get_notification_surface

description.summary: create a notification surface from a surface

request.description: Creates a notification_surface for the given surface, gives it the notification_surface role and associated it with a notification id.

interface.name: zcr_notification_shell_surface_v1
interface.description: An interface that may be implemented by a wl_surface to host notification contents.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Unmap and destroy the notification surface.

request.name: set_app_id
request.description: Set an application identifier for the notification surface.

interface.name: zcr_notification_shell_notification_v1
interface.description: An interface that controls the notification created by create_notification.

request.name: close
request.description: Closes the notification. The closed event is sent after this request.

event.name: closed
event.description: Notifies the notification object that the notification is closed.

arg.name: by_user
arg.summary: 1 if notification is closed by a user

event.name: clicked
event.description: Notifies the notification object that the notification or its button is clicked.

arg.name: button_index
arg.summary: -1 if the body of the notification is cliked as opposed to a button
